double_crochet ch1 double_crochet ch1 double_crochet ch1 double_crochet ch1 double_crochet all in same space 5dc 4 chain sps in this pattern every odd row is begun using the no turning chain double_crochet videos available on youtube if you do not know this method or prefer not to use it you may begin with ch4 to serve as first double_crochet and ch1 that follows i also begin with magic_ring magic_ring if you prefer to begin your top down shawls another way then do that i promise the crochet police will not be knocking down your door turn after every row begin with magic_ring row 1 work spine into magic_ring row 2 ch2 shell in first chain space single_crochet into next chain space ch3 single_crochet into next chain space shell into last chain space ch1 double_crochet into shell ch1 v in ch3 3x with last v being worked in ch2 at end of row writing it out it sounds more complicated than it actually is and i ll admit it is a tad fiddly but this is essentially a two-row repeat and if it looks familiar at all it s probably because you ve at least glanced at alita basically just remember shells have their own row and vs have their own row that the single_crochet ch3 single_crochet of the shell row gets worked into the ch1 single_crochet in center double_crochet of shell ch1 of the v row and everything else is just alternating shells and vs it is absolutely crucial you do not forget the ch2 at the start and double_crochet into last st at the end of every even-numbered row so that you have a place to put your first and last vs in the odd-numbered row otherwise your shawl will look funky rather
